alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 3:23PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, Mora and San Miguel. This includes the Hermit`s Peak Calf Canyon burn scar. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tierra Monte, Ledoux, Gascon, Morphy Lake State Park, Sapello, South Carmen, Rociada, Manuelitas and Monte Aplanado. - This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 16. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 9 and 15...and near Mile Marker 17. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermit`s Peak Calf Canyon burn area. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
